bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 9 (Thursday, January 13, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. EMMER:H.R. 6399.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8[Page H194]

item.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H979)
Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

summary.text:
Inflation Working Group Act

This bill establishes the U.S. Working Group on Inflation in Congress. The group must investigate the recent causes of elevated inflation and the relationships between inflation and gross domestic product growth, the labor market, poverty, crime, and other societal factors. The group must publish a report on their investigation and provide recommendations for actions to mitigate sustained inflation.

bill.title: Inflation Working Group Act

item.title: To establish the United States Working Group on Inflation.

latestAction.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H979)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
